trans-unit.source: In accessibility scenarios, represents a header cell in the rendered table of a tabular ASP.NET data-bound control, such as <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref>.
The DataControlFieldHeaderCell class is used by data tables (such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control) to represent accessible headers.

Tabular controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> are considered layout tables, and therefore do not require accessible headers and do not use the DataControlFieldHeaderCell class.
The DataControlFieldHeaderCell class is used in two cases: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.UseAccessibleHeader%2A> property is `true`.

- The field is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> object whose <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField.DataField%2A> property is set as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowHeaderColumn%2A> property.
If neither is the case, a regular DataControlFieldHeaderCell object is used, which renders a `<td>` instead of a `<th>` element.

Because the DataControlFieldHeaderCell class supports the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldHeaderCell.AbbreviatedText%2A> property, it is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control whenever the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.UseAccessibleHeader%2A> property is `true`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldHeaderCell"></xref> class, setting the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object as the cell's container.

The DataControlFieldHeaderCell constructor passes the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag?displayProperty=fullName> element as its `tagKey` parameter, which is the representation of the HTML tag it is rendered with.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> passed in the `containingField` parameter is used to determine whether to show headers and what styles to apply to the cell when it is rendered.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> that contains the current cell.
Gets or sets abbreviated text, which is rendered in an HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_abbr" name="abbr" href=""></xref> attribute and is used by screen readers.
The value of the AbbreviatedText property is stored in view state.
A shortened version of the table header text, which is read by screen readers.
The default value is <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Adds information about the table cell to the list of attributes to render.

The AddAttributesToRender method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> or <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> attributes if the respective <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldHeaderCell.Scope%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldHeaderCell.AbbreviatedText%2A> properties are set.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
Gets or sets the header cell's scope within an HTML table.
The value of the Scope property is rendered as an HTML `scope` attribute by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldHeaderCell> object.

Although the Scope property is initialized to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderScope>, you should set it to either <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderScope> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderScope>, depending on the cells that the header represents.
The value of the Scope property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderScope"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderScope"></xref>.
